justification: “Participants additionally completed the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale, which we did not analyze for this manuscript.”  The sentence explicitly states that the construct of impulsiveness was assessed with the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale.

measured_by: Mutual information between states and actions (Hutter estimator)
justification: “We defined policy complexity as the mutual information between the observed states and chosen actions… we estimated the policy complexity of each participant… using the Hutter estimator.”  Thus, policy complexity is quantified by mutual-information calculations implemented via the Hutter estimator.

measured_by: Participant difficulty ranking of each block
justification: “After completing the whole experiment, participants ranked the perceived difficulty for each block.”  The ranking procedure is the instrument used to measure perceived task difficulty.

The authors write that they predict “decreased action stochasticity (the conditional entropy of actions conditioned on state, H(A|S)) with longer ITIs,” indicating that conditional entropy serves as the measurement of action stochasticity.

measured_by: Probability of repeating the same action
justification: The manuscript defines perseveration as “the probability of repeating the same action,” showing that this probability metric is the operative measure of the perseveration construct.
